content.description:
Climb easy ground up to the first bolt, following the bolts through progressively harder slab climbing. Finish up at a large tree on the right, or continue up on gear. May want some small pieces to protect the slab, or prepare for runout sport.

5 bolts

Climb up the sloping corner onto the slabby face at 5.6ish climbing, and follow the orange "slushy" stain on the rock.



First route left of the Chimney.

bolted; anchor and rap rings at top

climbs.name: Dude, I Think She is the King

content.description:
Climb the slab past 2 small cam placements to a line of bolts.  Go right at the last bolt to a pin in the corner and then back left to a 1" crack which leads to a bolt anchor above the leaning cedar.

Start 10m right of Rob's Route.  
4 bolts

Climb the bolted S-shaped line up the sustained wall to the Metolius rap hangers for the first pitch of Perspective. 

This was the first sport climb at Eagle's Nest and was hand drilled while the first ascensionist's father belayed patiently over 2 days (bolts took 30 min. each!)  

10 feet right of Perspective at an aspen tree.
8 bolts

P1: At the large dirty ledge move left past a bolt into a treed gully to gain a slab. Climb the right line of bolts up to anchors. (25m) P2: Continue up past bolts to the left side of the roof to a large ledge sharing the anchor for Lichen It.

Same start as for Lichen It.
bolts and anchors

climbs.name: Finger Stinger
climbs.fa: FA David Smart, FFA Peter Reilly

content.description:
Climb the first pitch of 5.8 Stairway to Heaven. At the anchors, instead of going up and right (2nd pitch of Stairway to Heaven) go left towards the slight overhang that follows into the thin crack to the top. It is a thin diagonal traverse with good feet leading to the roof. Lay back onto the small ledge on the left side of the small roof, then smear and lay back the thin seam to progress higher into the crack. The uneven crackling has some good handjams in some spots, and some very thin laybacking in others. Fantastic Route to a 2 bolt anchor. Can 5.4 scramble for another 15 meters (50 feet) to the top (look for tat with carabiners on 2x trees for anchoring/repelling).



Must climb the first pitch of 5.8 Stairway to Heaven to approach 5.11b Finger Stinger.

Small cams in multiples up to .75. Can use a #2 under roof, but needs extension, or plug smaller gear along the continuous vertical crack instead (just back it up). 2 bolt anchor at the top.

Route description by FAist:

Pitch one (The Rocks) 5.9, 50ft: Dance up the technical cracks then up the left traverse to the arête beside the steep head wall. Stick-clipping the first bolt is recommended as the crux is low. 8 bolts. You can alternatively climb Tilting Planet and continue to the next pitch.

Pitch two (The Waters) 5.9, 88 ft: Crack your way up a deceivingly easy looking slab to a mid slab crux that takes a moment to figure out but feels good when you do. Follow the bolts to some fun moves into a traverse with lots of great holds all the way to the anchor for a relaxing finish. 9 bolts.

Pitch three (The Forests) 5.4, 40ft: Casual pitch that heads up a fun and easy little crack to Snake Ledge. Easy but mossy walk onto the ledge. 4 bolts.

Pitch four (The Skies) 5.6, 50ft: One of the best pitches on the route that follows more slab on great holds and great feet with an even more spectacular view. Wonderful way to finish it off. 6 bolts.

Note: You can combine pitches 3 and 4 easily.

Finish the route off by rapping back down from the top of pitch-four to the top of pitch-two. From here rap down through some trees that part to allow passage down to the top of pitch one. Rap to the ground from here.



Located left of central of all the bolted routes on the wall, roughly at the right end of the main parking lot. 

Bolted with fixed anchors

P1: Take the low angle offwidth crack up past some ledges to a large belay ledge with a geocache.  
 P2: Go around the right side of the large flake, and climb the crack to the top.

First route in from the approach trail next to the auto parts store. Obvious large crack on the corner.
Standard rack up to 4", a newer leader might want a 5" piece for some of the crux offwidth moves.

Follow the bolted line up a steep thin slab to rappel anchors. The hardest parts should be the start and at the 4th bolt.

15 feet left of Perspective.
5 bolts
50m granite cliffs in the heart of Bancroft. Featuring a few trad and sport climbs in the 1-3 pitch range.
